entry.title: AI-Assisted Chart Summary in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
We are thrilled to announce the General Availability of the AI-Assisted Chart Summary feature in SAP Analytics Cloud, add-in for Microsoft PowerPoint.
This new powerful capability is available as part of the Q3 2025 release.

 

What Is It?

The AI-Assisted Chart Summary leverages generative AI to automatically generate concise, human-readable summaries of SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) charts embedded in your PowerPoint presentations. Whether you're preparing for a meeting or sharing insights with stakeholders, this feature helps you communicate key takeaways faster and more clearly.

 

 

 

Benefits

  • Save Time: No more manually interpreting charts and writing manual summaries. AI-assisted chart summary delivers generated summary in seconds.
  • Enhance Clarity and boost accessibility: Summaries are crafted in natural language, making complex data accessible to everyone
  • Accelerate Decisions: By surfacing trends and key points instantly, users can act faster and smarter.
  • Stay Current: Summaries can be regenerated on demand to reflect any changes in the underlying chart data, ensuring your insights are always up to date.

 

How It Works

When working in SAC add-in for Microsoft PowerPoint, simply select a chart and click on “Generate Summary” button. The generated text is inserted in the current slide as an editable comment, allowing you to tailor the message if needed. And if your data changes? Just regenerate the summary with a click—no need to start from scratch.

 

 

 

Licensing & Availability

This feature is part of the broader AI-Assisted Features suite in SAC and requires:

  • A valid SAC license (BI or Planning)
  • An AI Units SKU contract

AI Units are consumed as the feature is used. Pricing and consumption details are available via the SAP Business AI Catalog.

 

Thanks for your interest. We hope you will enjoy using this new capability and look forward to your feedback.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
entry.content:
In today’s dynamic business environment, where speed and precision are critical to success, the ability to access, create, and act on information quickly has become a competitive advantage. That’s why we’re excited to introduce the latest AI-powered capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. They are designed to help your organization unlock greater productivity and smarter collaboration.  

With the addition of AI-based text generation, summarization, and comment generation, you can now accelerate content creation, quickly distill key insights from lengthy documents, and actively engage with workspace content, all directly within your digital workplace. 

As SAP Build Work Zone continues to evolve into an intelligent digital workspace, these new features bring built-in intelligence that reduces manual effort, accelerates decision-making, and enhances the overall employee experience.  

 

AI promotional model 

To help you explore these new capabilities, we’re offering them under a promotional model (totally free of charge) until December 31, 2025. During this period, each global account is entitled to 100,000 AI requests per calendar month across all instances of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. If the monthly quota is exceeded, users will receive a notification. The quota resets at the start of each month. 

After the promotional period ends, AI features will be available under a commercial model of SAP AI core. If you choose not to activate the commercial offering, the features will be automatically disabled. 

 

Availability 

The AI capabilities are powered by SAP AI Core and are available in the following data centers: 

  • AWS: Australia (Sydney), Brazil (São Paulo), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Frankfurt EU Access), Japan (Tokyo), Singapore, US East (VA) 
  • Microsoft Azure: Australia (Sydney), Europe (Netherlands), US East (VA) 
  • Google Cloud: Australia Southeast (Sydney), Europe (Frankfurt), India (Mumbai), KSA (Dammam – KSA Regulated Customers), US Central (IA) 

 

Enabling the AI features  

These AI-powered features can be enabled in the admin console. To get started, follow these simple steps: 

Step 1: Submit a Support Ticket 

Open a support ticket on component LOD-SF-SWZ requesting AI enablement for your subaccount. Make sure to include your environment details, which you can copy from the Admin Console > Overview screen using the Copy Info button. 

Step 2: Enable AI in the Admin Console 

Navigate to Administration Console > Feature Enablement > Features. Here you can select the AI features you want to activate. You’ll be prompted to review and accept the terms and conditions before proceeding. 

 

Explore the new AI features 

Once enabled using the steps above, you’ll find these capabilities integrated seamlessly into your workpages and workspace tools.  

1. AI Summarization 

This feature allows you to get the gist of long documents within seconds. AI Summarization helps you to condense large chunks of content such as wikis, blogs, workpages, and documents, into concise summaries.  

To summarize a content item, navigate to the workspace’s Content list from the navigation bar and select the document you want to process. When the content is open, click the Summarize button located at the top of the screen.  

The AI will then generate a summary that captures the key points of the original text.  

This feature supports content up to 100K words, making it a perfect tool for quickly grasping the essentials without having to read through long texts. 

2. AI Text Generation 

With this feature you can create compelling content with a few simple prompts. This feature helps you generate contextual text directly within your workpages. It is great for drafting introductions, elaborating ideas, or kickstarting any type of content. 

To use it, simply click on Add within a cell in your workspace and choose Generate Text from the dropdown menu.  

 

A dialog box will appear where you can enter your prompt. 

Based on this input, AI will generate relevant text, which may take a few moments to appear. Once the text is generated, you can further fine-tune the content to suit your style and requirements. Once you are satisfied you have the option to accept it, discard it, or generate a new version.  

3. AI Comment Generation 

Using this feature you can respond intelligently with AI-suggested comments. AI Comment Generation simplifies the process of engaging with content through contextual comments.  

To put this feature, open the Content list and select the specific content item you’d like to respond to. At the bottom of the screen, the AI icon can help you generate text with AI.  

Here you can enter a prompt or context.  

AI will then suggest relevant comment options for you to accept, discard or retry.

You can use this feature to contribute to discussions, provide feedback, or interact with colleagues. The same text generation experience is available when writing a news feed as well.

***** 

These AI-powered enhancements are just the beginning. At SAP, we're committed to helping you work more intelligently, engage more effectively, and innovate faster. Stay tuned as we continue to expand the AI capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, empowering your teams like never before.

entry.title: AI Copilots and the External Workforce: Reimaging the Future with Conversational Intelligence
entry.content:
In today’s fast-moving business landscape, where speed determines market leadership, the way organizations manage external talent is under intense scrutiny. Procurement and HR leaders are expected to deliver more—faster, smarter, and with greater accountability—but they’re often constrained by outdated, manual workflows that lag the pace of change. 

The rise of hybrid work, the surge in contingent labor, and the growing complexity of services procurement have created a perfect storm of operational friction. As pressure mounts to optimize spend, ensure compliance, and secure the right talent at the right time, the disconnect between executive expectations and system capabilities becomes increasingly clear — tools in place often deliver fragmentation, delays, and administrative burden. It’s no longer enough to simply digitize workflows. Executives are demanding real-time visibility, streamlined execution, and actionable insights.  

The current mandate is shifting from basic automation to intelligent orchestration powered by AI and copilots. Enterprise systems are no longer just expected to process tasks—they must evolve to anticipate user needs, guide decision-making, and unlock capacity at scale. Reflecting this shift, 44% of executives identify AI strategy and integration as a top priority for procurement teams over the next 12–18 months. 

As a leader in external workforce, SAP Fieldglass has taken a disciplined, strategic approach to artificial intelligence—one that prioritizes trust, transparency, and tangible business value. Focusing on deeply and seamlessly embedding it in the systems that power external workforce management. Delivering intelligence that understands the complexity of enterprise operations, respects data integrity, and scales with confidence. SAP Fieldglass’s AI is helping businesses run better by turning data into decisions, and decisions into outcomes. That’s what makes its approach essential for organisations navigating transformation at scale.  

 Joule and the Power of GenAI: Embedded Intelligence for Every Workflow 

The launch of Joule, SAP’s copilot, within SAP Fieldglass marks a transformative moment for organizations seeking to elevate their contingent labor and services procurement strategies. Joule is not just another tool—it’s a strategic enabler that redefines how practitioners interact with data, make decisions, and drive operational excellence. 

Joule introduces a conversational interface that allows users to interact with SAP Fieldglass in a natural, intuitive way. By shifting from manual navigation to intelligent dialogue executives and managers can now receive assistance with everyday tedious tasks – including multiple search and navigation enhancements, as well as assistance in the creation of job postings and SOWs – within contingent and Statement of Work (SOW) workflows, simply by engaging through a conversational interface. 

For users focused on speed and scale, Joule delivers a powerful suite of capabilities that streamline decision-making and execution: 

  • It guides users to best-fit templates and intelligently pre-fills key fields such as start dates. 
  • It retrieves complex reports—like quarterly budget and spend, worker headcount, and job postings—with ease. 
  • It quickly surfaces relevant help information from the SAP Help Portal site and actionable insights that would otherwise take hours to uncover. 

Together, these capabilities dramatically reduce time-to-action, minimize manual errors, accelerate the learning curve, and improve the overall user experience. Joule also enhances visibility and precision in workforce planning, empowering users to make informed decisions around vendor spend, talent allocation, and compliance risks. 

Joule is integrated directly into SAP Fieldglass, so it eliminates the need to toggle between systems or undergo extensive training, allowing teams to focus on outcomes rather than processes. This frictionless experience is particularly appealing to executives who value simplicity and efficiency in enterprise technology. 

Security and scalability are foundational to Joule’s design. Built within SAP’s trusted ecosystem, it adheres to rigorous governance standards, ensuring that innovation does not compromise compliance or unconscious bias. For organizations operating across geographies and industries, this means they can deploy Joule with confidence, knowing it meets the highest standards of data protection and operational integrity. 

SAP Fieldglass AI journey 

SAP Fieldglass has been at the forefront of integrating machine learning and artificial intelligence into its solutions for years. From intelligent resume assessments and skill-based candidate matching to automated job description creation, translation, and even SOW generation, SAP has consistently delivered AI-driven capabilities that enhance talent management and procurement processes. These innovations reflect a broader, ongoing commitment to embedding intelligence across the SAP ecosystem—an evolution that continues with the integration of Joule. 

SAP Fieldglass SOW Document AI is an intelligent document processing solution that streamlines the management of Statement of Work (SOW) documents within the SAP Fieldglass platform. Leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning, it automates the extraction, classification, and validation of key data from SOW PDFs, such as job roles, deliverables, durations, and financial terms. This reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and accelerates the onboarding and management of external workforce engagements. By integrating seamlessly with the Fieldglass ecosystem, SOW Document AI enhances compliance, improves data accuracy, and helps organizations make faster, more informed decisions when managing services procurement. 

In conclusion 

Looking ahead, Joule will include deeper analytics and expanded use cases across the SAP Business AI portfolio. This evolution will further empower leaders to harness AI in ways that are strategic, scalable, and deeply aligned with their organizational priorities.  

For executives ready to lead this transformation, Joule offers a unique opportunity to reimagine how work gets done. It’s not just about automation—it’s about unlocking new levels of insight, speed, and strategic control.  

SAP helps bring simplicity and clarity to all types of spending from all across a company. SAP invites customers and partners to take part in the transformation, shaping the future of intelligent workforce management together, so that you can take a step toward a smarter, more agile workforce.

Access Joule Studio from the SAP Build Lobby.

entry.title: AI-Assisted Note Corrections for Project Billing
entry.content:
Relevant for SAP Cloud ERP 2508. 

Introducing GenAI features in Project Billing 

With the 2508 release of SAP Cloud ERP, we are excited to introduce new intelligent features in Project Billing (4E9) that will revolutionize the way you process your bills. These enhancements are designed to make billing more efficient and accurate, saving you valuable time and effort. 

The Role of Billing Specialists 

Billing Specialists play a crucial role in reviewing cost postings recorded by consultants working on customer projects and preparing the bill. This process involves verifying the correct net rate, deciding which cost postings to include in the billing cycle, and determining the amount to bill.  

Smart Notes 

One of the most time-consuming tasks in this process of bill preparation is manually reviewing the notes maintained by consultants in the hundreds of cost postings considered for billing. 

This is where the Smart Notes feature in Project Billing comes to your rescue. Smart Notes is an AI-assisted feature that proposes grammatically corrected notes for items of the Time & Expenses (T&E) billing method with notes. These proposed notes are not only grammatically correct but also free from spelling errors. 

The biggest advantage of Smart Notes is that you can get these note proposals with a single click of the Smart Notes button in the Prepare Billing screen of the Manage Project Billing app. We support up to 500 T&E items with notes for note proposals in a single click. 

Flexibility and Control 

Billing Specialists have the flexibility to decide which note proposals should be accepted and saved, and which ones should be updated before saving. This way, we leverage the capability of GenAI to make your billing preparation faster while ensuring that the final decision on what notes are saved rests with the Billing Specialist. 

The feature best works for notes in English language. But do let us know your feedback for note proposals for notes in other languages.  

The notes saved in the Manage Project Billing app are also propagated to the Billing Document itemized list. This means that the note proposals reviewed and saved by the Billing Specialists can be made available in the Billing Document shared with your customer. This ensures that the notes are clear, self-explanatory and professional, reducing the time to settle the bill due to unclear communication. 

Do check the documentation in the Help portal for more details on this feature  AI-Assisted Smart Notes for Project Billing

 

Prerequisites 

To activate the Smart Notes feature, the following prerequisites must be in place: 

  • SAP AI Units 
  • Joule Premium for Financial Management 

Activation Steps  

You can get the Smart Notes feature activated via SAP for Me by navigating to: 

  • Dashboard- Portfolio & Products 
  • Business AI 
  • Look for the feature – Note Corrections for Project billing, in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  
  • Request Activation  

Summary  

The Smart Notes feature in the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release is set to transform the billing process, making it more efficient and accurate. By leveraging GenAI, we ensure that your billing preparation is faster and the communication with your customers is clear and professional. 

We hope you find this new feature exciting and beneficial. Happy billing!

entry.title: Stop AI Model Disasters: The Application Owner's Guide to Bulletproof Deployments
entry.content:
Co-Author: Lukas Pätz

So, you've deployed a fantastic application, leveraging the power of SAP‘s Generative AI Hub (linked reference architecture)! That's a significant step towards building intelligent business processes.

As a quick reminder: SAP’s Generative AI Hub is part of the AI Foundation. SAP’s AI Foundation, similar to an operating system provides the means to build, extend, and run custom AI solutions and agents at scale. It includes the generative AI Hub in SAP AI Core, which is a rich set of AI capabilities (40+ frontier AI models, orchestration, SDKs, etc.), for productive purpose, running on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

Your application runs on BTP, and LLM technology powers the intelligence behind it. But here's what you can't delegate: managing the LLM’s Lifecycle for your application.

 

Understanding Model Lifecycle: A Key Distinction

Before diving into the model lifecycle, let's clarify the different ways you can leverage AI models:

  • Your self-hosted Models: You bring your own models (e.g., fine-tuned open-source models, proprietary models) and deploy them. This is akin to a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offering, where you manage the model artifacts, their dependencies, and their whole lifecycle on your own.  This gives you maximum flexibility: you can select, customize, and optimize models to fit your exact needs, including full control over versioning and performance. However, with that freedom comes responsibility. You’re in charge of the full lifecycle — from infrastructure and scaling to security, compliance, monitoring, costs and updates.
  • SAP Managed Models: This is comparable to a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) offering. The Generative AI Hub provides pre-integrated, managed access to various LLMs from leading providers (i.e Azure OpenAI GPT-5, Google Gemini 2.5 Pro, AWS Claude Sonnet 4, etc.). It's important to understand that you do not need to acquire separate licenses for these LLMs; SAP handles the commercial agreements and technical integration. Furthermore, SAP takes on the responsibility for data privacy and security or confidentiality standards, related to the LLMs consumed through the Generative AI Hub, significantly reducing your operational burden.

For the following we focus on the latter. LLMs, the powerful engines behind generative AI, are constantly evolving. Model providers release new versions, older versions might be retired, and factors like performance and cost can change, as indicated by the graphic below. This dynamic environment means that the specific LLM version your application relies on today might not be available tomorrow.

 

Why Does This Matter to You, the Application Owner?

Here's the reality: AI models get retired. Your application depends on them. Without a lifecycle management strategy, you're one model retirement away from downtime —and missing out on better quality from newer models.

Moreover, different model versions may offer significantly better performance. A newer model might produce more accurate summaries which can directly impact your application's quality, user satisfaction, and business outcomes. Not updating could mean missing out on substantial improvements in capability, efficiency, or cost-effectiveness.

Your Role: Stay Informed, Be Prepared

Your primary responsibility regarding the model lifecycle is to:

  • Stay informed about the models supported by the SAP’s Generative AI Hub, including their versions, capabilities, cost, and most importantly, their retirement dates.
  • Have a plan for upgrading your application's model configuration when necessary.

Let's have a look on how you can fulfill these responsibilities using the tools and information available.

Staying Informed: Where to Find Model Information

SAP’s Generative AI Hub provides several ways to discover and understand the available LLMs:

  • SAP Notes:

    The central source of truth for supported models is SAP Note 3437766. This note provides comprehensive information, including the list of available models, supported versions, token conversion rates, rate limits, and retirement dates. Regularly checking this note is essential. You can access it via https://me.sap.com/notes/3437766. Crucially, you can subscribe to this SAP Note (indicated by the star icon) to receive automatic notifications via email about any changes, ensuring you're always up-to-date.

  • SAP AI Launchpad (UI):

    It's the natural place for an application owner to explore the Model Library and discover available models and their details. The Model Library also supports through comparison functionalities like the Leaderboard tab. Here you can see similar or better performing models.

  • Discovery API Endpoint:

    For programmatic access or detailed inspection, you can use the discovery API endpoint. By sending a GET request to the {{apiurl}}/v2/lm/scenarios/{scenarioid}/models endpoint, you can retrieve a list of all available models, their versions, capabilities, and retirement dates. This is a powerful tool for checking information dynamically. Find further information about that on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

By utilizing these resources, you can proactively identify when the model your application relies on is approaching its retirement date and plan your next steps.

Taking Action: Upgrading Your Model

When it's time to switch to a newer model version (preceded by tests/benchmarks), you have two main strategies, decided during the initial deployment configuration:

  • Auto Upgrade (modelVersion: latest):

    • How it works: When you create your generative AI configuration for a specific LLM, either through orchestration API or as a deployment, you can set the modelVersion parameter to latest. This will automatically use the most recent version of the specified model that is supported.
    • Pros: Less manual effort. As we support newer versions, your deployment will automatically shift, potentially giving you access to model improvements without intervention.
    • Cons: Less control. Your application might suddenly start using a new model version which, although intended to be compatible, could introduce subtle changes in behavior or performance that you haven't explicitly tested. This can be particularly problematic if your application relies on consistent LLM output behavior. Furthermore, it won't help in the situation of moving to different models (i.e. GPT-4.1 to GPT-5).

  • Manual Upgrade (Specify <modelVersion>):

    • How it works: When creating your orchestration configuration, you specify a particular modelVersion, like "2024-05-13". When this specific version is close to retirement, you will need to:
      1. Select a suitable newer model version based on your benchmarks using the SAP Note, Discovery API and/or UI.
      2. Via our harmonized API in orchestration, it is easy for you to change your configuration to a newer, specific model version.

        And only if you handle your custom defined endpoint:

      3. Patch upgrade your existing deployment to the configurationId you created newly.
    • Pros: Full control. You decide exactly which model version your application uses and when to make the change, allowing for thorough testing beforehand. This is especially important for production systems where behavioral changes in LLMs can have significant impacts.
    • Cons: More manual effort. You must actively monitor retirement dates and perform the upgrade steps yourself.

Choosing Your Strategy: Best Practices

The best strategy depends on your application's needs for stability versus automatically receiving updates.

For most production applications, especially those sensitive to potential behavioral changes in LLMs, specifying a fixed modelVersion (Manual Upgrade) has emerged as a best practice. While it requires more manual effort, it provides the necessary control and predictability. Most application owners prefer not to use the latest parameter due to the risk of unexpected behavior shifts with new LLM versions. By fixing the version, you safeguard against such changes and can plan updates proactively.

If stability and controlled changes are paramount, opt for Manual Upgrade by specifying a fixed modelVersion and plan for scheduled updates. This allows you to thoroughly test new model versions in a controlled environment before deploying them to production.

If minimizing operational overhead and automatically getting the latest model version is preferred for non-critical or exploratory applications, use Auto Upgrade with modelVersion: latest. However, remain aware that behavior might change with new versions and you need to change from model to model.

 

In Summary

As an application owner, understanding and managing the LLM model lifecycle is key to your application's longevity and reliability.

  • Regularly consult SAP Note 3437766 and/or the Discovery API (or the UI) to track model versions and retirement dates. Remember to subscribe to the SAP Note for automated updates.
  • Choose an appropriate upgrade strategy (latest for automatic updates or specifying a modelVersion for manual control) when setting up your configuration and deployment. For production scenarios, specifying a fixed modelVersion is generally recommended as a best practice.
  • If using manual upgrades, proactively change your configuration within orchestration and if custom deployment is used you need to patch/upgrade the current model version before it expires.

By staying informed and prepared, you can ensure your generative AI application continues to deliver value seamlessly, leveraging the latest innovations from the SAP’s Generative AI Hub.

We recommend keeping a close eye on the What's new section for upcoming release announcements and implementation guidance.

AI is only as powerful as the data it runs on. Inaccurate context, broken semantics, or outdated master data can turn automation from an advantage into a risk—costing companies millions each year in delays, errors, and lost trust.  

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a trusted data foundation by preserving semantics, logic, and context of enterprise data. This eliminates manual data work, accelerates decision-making, and enables CFOs, COOs, and CIOs to act on accurate, contextual data.

Imagine an AI that automatically optimizes pricing to clear inventory while protecting margins—without human input. Now imagine that AI running on inaccurate data: the wrong currency, outdated master data, or misaligned cost centers. Suddenly, automation isn’t an advantage—it’s a risk. 

This is why data can no longer be treated as a back-office IT asset—it’s a strategic business capability. The companies leading in AI aren’t the ones with the most data, but the ones with the right data, at the right time, with the right context.

The typical workaround? Manual fixes: recreating data context, writing custom scripts, and rebuilding SAP’s logic in other tools. These solutions are often fragile, expensive, manual and error prone. Leading companies are changing course—not by rebuilding data outside SAP, but by activating the trusted business logic already in place.

SAP Business Data Cloud helps organizations turn fragmented data into a trusted foundation for decision-making. By unifying data across systems and preserving the business context that gives it meaning it significantly reduces the need for manual reconciliation or reengineering.  

The result is now reversed because the data is accurate, and actionable, enabling faster execution, stronger alignment, and higher return on data investments. 

How SAP Business Data Cloud strengthens enterprise data foundations: 

  • Preserve context natively: context, semantics, logic, and hierarchies stay intact—no rework needed. 
  • Deliver trusted, reusable data products: Instead of manually preparing data for every model or report, teams can access governed, curated assets that reflect real business truth. 
  • Empower intelligent applications: With high-quality, harmonized data at their core, applications for planning, forecasting, sustainability, and operations drive insights where decisions happen real time—not after the fact.

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you’re an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA , SAP Analytics Cloud ,  Artificial Intelligence , SAP Business Technology Platform , within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor’s or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2–3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP’s mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via 👉  SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP’s social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

Written by Valentina Guevara.

About Me

Hare Krishna 🙏 I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

Introduction: Simplifying Grocery Business with AI 🥦🛒

Grocery businesses handling food items and eatables want to deliver products faster, reduce mistakes, and delight customers. SAP offers a suite of AI tools that can automate, predict, and optimize business processes. In this example, we’ll show how a large grocery chain can transform its Order-to-Cash (O2C) process—from receiving orders to delivering products and receiving payments—using SAP AI tools.

Note: O2C is the flow where a customer places an order, the company delivers the product, and receives payment.

1. Organizing Data with SAP Datasphere 🏢💾📊

Objective: Combine data from sales, inventory, shipments, and suppliers into one view.

How it works:

  • Connect SAP systems and external sources (like supply chain partners and e-commerce platforms) 🔗.

  • Transform raw data into business-friendly models for orders, deliveries, and payments 🗂️.

Benefit for growth:
A grocery chain can reduce stock-outs and overstock 📉, understand customer buying patterns 🛍️, and ensure timely deliveries 🚚. With a single source of truth, managers make faster and more informed decisions 🧠.

Analogy: Central nervous system – integrates and harmonizes all data from multiple sources.

2. Managing AI Services with SAP AI Foundation ⚙️🛠️📈

Objective: Provide infrastructure and services to deploy, monitor, and orchestrate AI models efficiently.

How it works:

  • SAP AI Foundation handles model orchestration, monitoring, logging, and deployment pipelines 🖥️.

  • Works seamlessly with AI Core, ML DI tenants, and other AI services 🔄.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can scale AI solutions reliably ⚡, ensuring smooth operations across multiple stores and warehouses 🏬 without disruptions. Managers can monitor model performance in real-time 🕵️, improving efficiency and reducing costs 💰.

Analogy: AI control center – orchestrates and monitors AI models and workflows.

3. Predicting Outcomes with SAP AI Core & ML DI Tenants 🤖📡🔮

Objective: Predict delivery delays, demand spikes, or payment issues.

How it works:

  • Build predictive models in SAP AI Core 🧩.

  • Use ML DI tenants to access pre-trained AI models or train new ones using integrated data from SAP Datasphere 🗄️.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can anticipate high-demand periods 📈, avoid perishable food wastage 🥬❌, and ensure timely replenishment 🚛. Predictive insights also help in identifying potential payment delays 💳 or customer churn 🔄, boosting revenue and trust.

Analogy: Predictive brain – builds and deploys AI models for forecasting and insights.

4. Automating Tasks with SAP Build Process Automation 🔄🤖📝

Objective: Reduce manual work and speed up processes.

How it works:

  • Automate routine O2C tasks like approving orders ✅, sending invoices 🧾, and following up on payments 📬.

  • Integrate AI predictions to trigger actions automatically ⚡.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can process orders faster ⏱️, minimize human errors ❌, and focus staff on higher-value tasks 💼. Automation ensures smoother operations and higher customer satisfaction 😃.

Analogy: Workflow robot – automates repetitive tasks and business processes.

Objective: Provide real-time insights and recommendations.

How it works:

  • SAP Joule offers suggestions, such as which deliveries might be delayed ⏳ or which customers need follow-up 📞.

  • Employees can take immediate, informed actions 🏃‍♂️.

Benefit for growth:
Employees make smarter decisions faster ⚡, improving delivery efficiency 🚚, customer loyalty ❤️, and operational agility 🏬. Real-time guidance reduces mistakes and accelerates response times ⏱️.

Analogy: Smart advisor – gives insights in real-time.

6. Integrating Security & Identity with SAP BTP IAS/IPS 🔒🛡️🔑

Objective: Secure AI and process automation tools while ensuring correct user access.

How it works:

  • IAS manages Single Sign-On (SSO) 🔐 for employees interacting with SAP AI tools.

  • IPS ensures only authorized users are provisioned into the system 👤.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain protects sensitive customer and supplier data 🗂️, ensures compliance 📋, and safely enables access to AI tools across multiple locations 🌐.

Analogy: Security gatekeeper – ensures authorized access to AI tools & data.

7. Monitoring & Continuous Improvement with SAP Cloud ALM 📊🖥️⚡

Objective: Ensure the system works well and keeps improving.

How it works:

  • Track AI model performance and automated workflows using SAP Cloud ALM 📈.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can continuously improve operations 🏬, adapt to market changes 🔄, and maintain high customer satisfaction 😃. Monitoring helps spot inefficiencies before they affect operations ⚠️.

Analogy: System monitor – tracks performance & supports continuous improvement.

How it works:

  • Works seamlessly with SAP Build Process Automation and AI predictions to trigger automated workflows immediately.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can respond instantly to order changes, prevent stockouts, and ensure customers get accurate delivery updates 🚚📲. Real-time events also help coordinate multiple stores and warehouses efficiently 🏬, improving overall operational agility.

entry.title: Process-Aware Agentic Testing of SAP with Int4 Suite
entry.content:
Process-Aware Agentic Testing of SAP with Int4 Suite

Let’s start with a simple example every SAP consultant knows:

Test Case: Create Standard Sales Order (VA01)

Step 1: Enter transaction code VA01 in the command box.
Expected Result: “Create Sales Order” initial screen is displayed.

Step 2: On the initial screen, enter details like:

  • Order Type: <ip_Order_Type>
  • Sales Organization: <ip_Sales_Org>
  • Distribution Channel: <ip_distr_channel>
  • Division: <ip_division>

Step 3: Click Enter.

Step 4: Enter header details such as:

  • PO Number: <ip_PO_number>
  • Sold-to Party: <ip_sold_to_party>
  • Ship-to Party: <ip_ship_to_party>
  • PO Date: <ip_PO_date>

Step 5: Enter item details:

  • Material: <ip_Material>
  • Order Quantity: <ip_Order_qty>
  • Plant: <ip_plant>

Step 6: Click Save.
Expected Result: “Standard Order XXXXXX has been saved.”

Looks perfect on paper. But in real life, there are two big problems:

  1. Where to get the correct data to start the test? A VA01 script needs valid values for customer, material, plant, and so on. Guesswork doesn’t work. The best source is historical data already posted on production by one of the integrations. Int4 Suite can use millions of these API transactions as the foundation for realistic tests.

  1. What if the required master or stock data is missing in test? Even with a historical sales order in hand, posting might fail because the material never existed in the test system, the customer master is missing, or there’s no stock. This is where Int4 Suite acts agentically: it can copy the missing material from production, create stock via another API, and retry posting automatically.

This is the heart of Process-Aware Agentic Testing. Process-aware, because the software knows what data and conditions are needed for the test. Agentic, because it acts on its own to prepare that business context and complete the transaction.

And this problem is not limited to VA01. In many SAP projects, test automation still works in a very “dry” way. A tool calls a transaction with some example data and checks the response. Technically it works, but it’s not how real business runs. It’s like testing a car engine without fuel in the tank, without air in the tires, and without a driver inside. The engine starts, but you can’t really drive anywhere.

Dry testing always brings the same frustrations:

  • Functinal consultants must provide “reference data”,
  • missing objects must be prepared manually – by functional consultants,
  • results are very hard to repeat.

Int4 Suite changes this. With access to millions of historical API transactions and the ability to prepare business objects through SAP S/4HANA APIs, it makes every test run in full business context.

  • Example 1: Posting a historical sales order fails because the material is missing. Int4 Suite copies the material from production, creates stock, and retries the posting.
  • Example 2: Testing a delivery fails because the sales order doesn’t exist in test. Int4 Suite can post a new sales order via API based on historical data, and then create the delivery.

For SAP S/4HANA projects, this is a new paradigm. Instead of brittle scripts and endless manual setup, you get agentic, process-aware testing: tests that adapt, prepare their own data, and validate full business processes end-to-end.

In short: don’t just test if a transaction runs. Test if it runs with the right business context. That’s the future of SAP testing with Int4 Suite.

entry.title: Realizing AI’s Potential in and Through SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Realizing AI’s Potential in and Through SAP Integration Suite 

AI is reshaping how enterprises approach integration, simplifying complex processes, reducing manual effort, and unlocking new levels of agility. In SAP Integration Suite, AI is more than just a trend: it is both a set of powerful capabilities enhancing integration today, and a key enabler for intelligent, connected systems in the future.  

  • AI in Integration Suite – Intelligence is embedded directly into the product to enhance developer productivity, improve operational efficiency, and accelerate time to cloud through features like flow generation and optimization, anomaly detection, and intelligent troubleshooting and monitoring. 
  • Integration Suite for AI – SAP Integration Suite also plays a vital role in enabling next-generation AI scenarios. It acts as the integration foundation for orchestrating autonomous, context-aware agents and supporting seamless interaction between AI systems and enterprise landscapes, backed by the governance and scalability that modern businesses need. 

This blog offers a practical overview of SAP Integration Suite’s evolving AI capabilities, highlighting how AI is embedded in SAP Integration Suite today, how it maps to key integration needs, and how it enables customers to build toward an AI-augmented future. 

 

AI in Integration Suite: Embedded Intelligence in Action

AI is not an isolated feature in SAP Integration Suite, instead, it’s woven into the platform to enhance how integrations are designed, built, and operated. Our embedded AI capabilities focus on delivering real, day-to-day value across two core dimensions: 

  • Improve developer productivity
  • Enhance operational excellence

Here’s how embedded intelligence is making an impact in these areas: 

Improve Developer Productivity 

Designing integrations can be time-consuming, especially when dealing with complex mappings, unfamiliar systems, or writing custom scripts to handle specific logic. SAP Integration Suite embeds AI to streamline this process and help developers move faster with greater confidence. 

  • iFlow Creation
    Developers can now generate integration flows simply by describing the scenario in natural language. This generative AI capability interprets the intent, assembles a draft iFlow with relevant flow steps, and gives developers a strong starting point, and significantly accelerating the design phase. Future enhancements are expected to include automatic generation of mappings, scripts, and other artifacts to further streamline the process. Check the roadmap for new updates. 

 

  • Script Optimization
    Generative AI in SAP Integration Suite can help developers refine Groovy and JavaScript scripts by analyzing code in real time and suggesting best-practice optimizations. These recommendations reduce the need for manual tuning, streamline the coding process and help maintain high performance and quality from the outset.
  • Integration Advisor
    Integration Suite is one of the first iPaaS to embed AI into capabilities for supporting B2B scenarios. Integration Advisor uses a machine learning-based, global knowledge pool to propose mappings between source and target structures. By learning from industry standards and past implementations, it dramatically reduces the time and effort required to configure B2B and A2A integrations, especially in complex message transformation scenarios.
  • Flow Step Recommendations
    When developers build integration flows, AI recommends the next logical flow step, such as a Groovy script or End Message, based on usage patterns. This intelligent guidance accelerates the flow creation process, minimizes trial-and-error, and supports consistent design quality across teams.

Together, these capabilities significantly reduce repetitive tasks, speed up development, and help teams deliver high-quality integrations more efficiently, regardless of their experience level. 

 

Enhance Operational Excellence 

Operational reliability is critical for scalable, enterprise-grade integration. SAP Integration Suite embeds AI to help teams proactively monitor, maintain, and optimize their integration landscapes, reducing manual troubleshooting and improving long-term performance. 

  • API Anomaly Detection 
    Leveraging machine learning, the platform continuously monitors integration flows and APIs to detect unusual patterns, such as latency spikes, increased error rates, or unexpected traffic surges. This helps teams identify and address issues before they impact business processes, improving response time and reducing downtime. 

 

  • API Volume Prediction
    AI models analyze historical usage patterns to forecast, providing two distinct insights: one on historical usage trends and the other on predicted future volumes. The dual view helps developers and operations teams stay ahead of peak loads and avoid capacity-related disruptions, ensuring both long-term planning and real-time operational awareness.
  • Script Optimization
    Generative AI analyzes custom Groovy or JavaScript scripts used in integration flows, identifying potential performance bottlenecks or inefficiencies. It then recommends optimized versions of the code, enabling developers to improve execution quality without deep manual debugging or rewriting.

By embedding these intelligent capabilities, SAP Integration Suite supports a more proactive, data-driven approach to integration operations, allowing teams to deliver higher reliability with less overhead. 

 

Integration Suite for AI: Enabling the Next Generation of Intelligent Automation

As the enterprise landscape evolves, agentic AI is emerging as a new class of autonomous systems that can reason, interact, and execute tasks on behalf of users. This shift is driving demand for more adaptable and intelligent integration backbones. To function effectively, these AI agents must be able to connect with enterprise systems, orchestrate business logic, access data, and execute workflows securely and reliably. This is where SAP Integration Suite becomes essential. It not only embeds AI to optimize development and operations, but also plays a foundational role in enabling agentic AI by providing the connective fabric that links intelligent agents with business applications and services. 

Across the industry, we’re seeing a growing push toward agent-centric automation, from AI copilots to autonomous digital workers, and integration is the linchpin that determines whether these agents can truly act in context. SAP Integration Suite helps enterprises bridge this gap with built-in capabilities that simplify how AI agents discover, consume, and govern enterprise integrations. 

Here are two ways it already supports this shift: 

  • AI Adapter
    The AI Adapter enables seamless communication between SAP Integration Suite and generative AI services, provided by SAP’s AI Core or third-party providers like OpenAI. With minimal configuration, developers can embed AI capabilities, such as text generation, summarization, or classification, directly into integration flows. This makes it easier to enrich payloads with contextual insights, automate decision logic, and integrate AI-driven functionality within a governed framework. By removing the need for custom scripting or API handling, the AI Adapter boosts developer efficiency and expands the scope for advanced AI-powered use cases. 
  • AI-Powered Content Recommendations in Business Accelerator Hub
    To help agents and developers access the right integration assets quickly, the SAP Business Accelerator Hub features Joule for natural language search. Instead of browsing manually, users (or agents in the future) can ask questions like “How do I connect SAP S/4HANA to Salesforce?” and receive tailored recommendations across integration flows, APIs, and templates. This AI-driven discovery process reduces time to integration and enhances reusability, which is the key requirement for agent-based automation where responsiveness and adaptability are critical.

 

Where We’re Heading 

The evolution of AI in SAP Integration Suite is accelerating, expanding beyond foundational productivity and monitoring features into more adaptive, intelligent, and autonomous integration experiences. 

On the embedded AI front, we’re advancing how integrations are designed, optimized, and managed. Expect more powerful capabilities for automating integration development and API operations, along with intelligent migration from legacy systems like SAP Process Orchestration. These innovations are designed to further boost developer efficiency, reduce operational overhead, and reduce time to cloud. 

At the same time, SAP Integration Suite is evolving to support agent-driven automation. As part of this direction, we plan to enhance the API Management to allow AI systems to interact with enterprise tools and data. This will enable more dynamic, context-aware automation, built on a foundation of governance, scalability and future readiness. 

In the upcoming blogs, we’ll explore each of the two directions in depth, highlighting real-world use cases, customer stories, and innovations that are redefining integration in the era of AI.

entry.title: Give your Joule Agents 🤖 the gift of Memory 💭, with Hana Cloud ✨
entry.content:
When Joule agents can write/read memories in SAP HANA Cloud, they:

  • Remember business facts at scale (supplier habits, contract quirks, SLA exceptions) ✅

  • Retrieve them fast & accurately with HANA Cloud Vector Engine ⚡

  • Keep memories human-readable, sortable, and dead-simple to implement 🧩

That means fewer repeated mistakes, smarter suggestions, and agents that actually learn with your business over time.

An example of some memories for an invoice exception agent.
You can make them as detailed or a simple as you want in the agent prompt!

 

 

How it works

  1. A simple “Memories” table

    Human-readable text + metadata (who/what it’s about, when learned, importance, TTL, etc.).

    Optional: a vector column for semantic search.

  2. Vector search for recall

    Store an embedding of each memory → use approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) to fetch the right facts instantly (“Which supplier often uses expired POs?”). BM25 or other strategies are available. I love BM25's reliability for same-language and same-topic knowledge meshes.

  3. One tool your agent calls

    Add a tool (below) so your agent can append or update memories whenever it learns something new.

  4. Update the Agent prompt to have it use the memory well!

           Something like:

Before answering, search (memory.search_hana) with a concise query (supplier/invoice/PO terms; limit top_k≤8); 
use the results to tailor your response. 
Only write when you learn a new, stable, factual business detail; 
upsert (memory.upsert_hana) instead of inserting duplicates—treat as duplicate if normalized context matches or vector similarity ≥0.86 and the same entity (supplier/invoice/PO) is involved; 
if duplicate, refresh last_seen_at (and occurrence_count if available). Format memories as one dense sentence in context 
(e.g., YYYY-MM-DD | INV-XXXX | Supplier ABC | PO 4500001123 | 4,980.00 EUR | expired PO used) 
and a brief actionable description; keep context ≤220 chars, use present tense. 
Set importance 1–5 (5 = critical risk) and ttl_days (low importance decays, 0 = never expires). 
Do not store ephemeral chatter or sensitive data; prefer patterns over one-offs. 
If you update or add a memory, mention it briefly to the user; otherwise be concise and never dump full tables unless asked.

 

Add two memory tools (Joule Skills)

"Add Memory" is a simple SQL Write

"Retrieve Memory" is a simple SQL Read, with semantic search (BM25+Embeddings)

 

 

Advanced memory patterns (that HANA makes easy) 🚀

  • Disappearing memories (decay/TTL): small quirks fade unless they’re re-observed.

  • Hierarchical memories: supplier-site → supplier → region → global policy.

  • World representations: keep a simple graph of relationships (supplier↔plant, approver↔cost center), or materialize views for fast joins.

  • Learning from mistakes: tag memories with resolution outcome so the agent prefers strategies that worked.

 

Result:

A living, human-readable knowledge fabric your Joule agents can trust.
It's fast, explainable, and always improving. ✨
